name: damselfly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an insect with a long, thin body and two pairs of transparent wings that are usually folded against its body when it is not flying: Damselflies are similar to dragonflies, but smaller and thinner. Butterflies, damselflies and dragonflies fill the air.
Amith Nag Photography/Moment/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesThe damselfly can often be seen settling on trees and bushes lining the banks of fast, clear streams. With most damselflies, the male and female differ in their colouring.The damselfly will hold its wings together over its back, while the dragonfly spreads its wings out flat, away from the body.
